title: Elementary – Cycle 3 – Progression of Learning - Physical Education and Health (2009)
subject: Personal Development

document.title: Elementary – Cycle 3 – Progression of Learning - Physical Education and Health (2009)

347BB7D637414F79927FB70AD16E3468.description: Identifies the body’s response during or after physical activity (e.g. heat, perspiration, shortness of breath, increased heart rate, muscular fatigue)

BF749DF4936449B4BB7EC6400BC103C3.description: Explains in his/her own words the overall function of the muscular system during physical activity

29DDA271318040AC91AB4B777F74FA37.description: Explains in his/her own words the main function of the respiratory system during physical activity

3FC864B9150E4AFBAB6E3E0B49F5A439.description: Explains in his/her own words the main function of the cardiovascular system during physical activity

58717CDFF8E9498DBE017A26D1E96216.description: Identifies the main joints in the body (e.g. elbows, knees, ankles)

46CBE25629104E9BACCADDA4DEC1908B.description: Distinguishes a bone from a muscle

208150C48A3A4291B2512A0FE84A1AA4.description: Knowledge (anatomy and physiology of the human body)- Competency 3: To adopt a healthy, active lifestyle

93E2397C882545058BD6EB7A0058E728.description: Explains in his/her own words a few of the effects of a sedentary lifestyle on cardiovascular endurance (e.g. shortness of breath, cramps, lack of endurance during a race)

23D1ABA01DA84DD8A384B50F353A6635.description: Explains in his/her own words a few of the effects of a sedentary lifestyle on muscle mass (e.g. loss of muscle tone and strength)

D06539AA1847462B8EA9F448123A479C.description: Explains in his/her own words a few of the effects of a sedentary lifestyle on flexibility (e.g. loss of flexibility)

97EC76D726E140E5AED3B4D488475185.description: Explains in his/her own words a few of the effects of a sedentary lifestyle on weight (e.g. causes weight gain, diseases such as diabetes)

396E13E315294BAF9A734133536C9871.description: Explains in his/her own words what “sedentary lifestyle” means (e.g. not doing any physical activity, spending a lot of time in front of a computer)

B4D7933B2ED2402F83BB32C638A057CD.description: Knowledge (effects of a sedentary lifestyle): Competency 3: To adopt a healthy, active lifestyle

CE027B443C9544B987E6B236D779186C.description: Names some stress management strategies (e.g. engaging in physical activity, laughing, performing relaxation exercises, playing with friends)

98F92C6F75AE428F8A6770C565F174FA.description: Explains in his/her own words the importance of managing one’s stress (e.g. to better adapt to situations, have better self-control, develop better relations with others)

C8A9F2501D7A4ABABF2EEECF335AD600.description: Names some sources of stress in everyday life (e.g. sports competition, conflict, exams, bullying)

4E57446D428844AFBA6C82E3E3EF1F31.description: Explains positive and negative forms of stress in his/her own words (e.g. response to a situation perceived as stressful or stimulating)

D654E4B48D804DD1A3C1E8D679522094.description: Performs a few mental relaxation exercises (e.g. visualization)

E6FCE8DA28B14B97BD3DCB94FE56371D.description: Performs some physical relaxation exercises (e.g. lies down in resting position, breathes deeply [abdominal breathing], contracts and relaxes muscles)

23970E739FBD4F1C9098EBD5C97987A2.description: Explains in his/her own words a few benefits of relaxation (e.g. it reduces muscle tension, helps the body recover after a physical effort)

FC7D51B4FD864C3BB44D381F49679F90.description: Explains in his/her own words the importance of washing oneself after engaging in physical activity

A78B0F2A47A646EA87D8A3C66E0FC93E.description: Explains in his/her own words the importance of washing one’s clothes after engaging in physical activity

AF76112A73AE4F13A2FDC673772E4769.description: Explains in his/her own words the importance of changing one’s clothes after engaging in physical activity

FE74B5510BF3442BB4E5F9785C84B5F3.description: Personal hygiene related to physical activity

6AB070F0868C472395CEB9ACB076B1CA.description: Distinguishes between muscular exercises and cardiovascular exercises

1EC83ED794D545719E80B6BC5E91ED21.description: Performs a few muscular exercises in the upper and lower limbs (e.g. arm extensions, sit-ups)

2038A6CB36A14216AF1AB26F0E11B84A.description: Explains in his/her own words the importance of muscular exercises (e.g. to tone muscles, work the entire body, help prevent injury)

11060D22DEC141539D14785B003636E3.description: Explains in his/her own words how to pace oneself depending on the physical activity, its duration, intensity or distance to be covered (e.g. to make sustained, even effort; save some energy to finish the activity)

363C5B8D2D1E46FEBF5CB6E90FD9822C.description: Explains in his/her own words the importance of measuring one’s heart rate before, during and after physical activity (e.g. to pace oneself, determine the time needed to recover)

27A2AA177D0C46FB8435710E4CE15FB9.description: Measures his/her heart rate at the wrist (radial artery) or neck (carotid artery)

C8F1357954B44619AA7BD5CA17A9E105.description: Explains in his/her own words the importance of cardiovascular exercise (e.g. the heart is a muscle and it must be kept in shape; less breathlessness)

F296CAD4C14B45A383490EAE9FF7C2A3.description: Makes recommendations in his/her own words for improving or maintaining cardiovascular endurance (e.g. type of activity, nature [continuous, discontinuous], intensity, duration and frequency)

47CF2963A333487191FBC26915855310.description: Recognizes the level of intensity depending on the type of physical activity (e.g. slow walking = low intensity, cross-country skiing = moderate to high intensity)

B6B4E8BACA9042D0BED81BABCCB8F360.description: Explains in his/her own words the importance of proper posture (e.g. to prevent unnecessary muscle tension and back pain)

F020614A8B0A4D4193EE328EDDCDC58A.description: Identifies postures that are beneficial (e.g. standing straight, shoulders relaxed) or harmful (e.g. lifting a load without bending at the knees) depending on the type of activity

93B493346ABD47FC93A647594E754EB2.description: Adopts proper posture while sitting on the floor and while standing (e.g. sitting cross-legged)

AC7BB52A140242729DE1FD9746BBFB3D.description: Explains in his/her own words a few principles of stretching effectively and safely (e.g. appropriate time, steps to follow, proper position, duration)

8E9065A2A70B42D4978F8D930C5C5A47.description: Performs stretching exercises (e.g. stretches arm, thigh muscles)

7C593C697EE543D392169AD8510AFFE4.description: Explains in his/her own words the importance of stretching (e.g. to increase the range and ease of motion of a muscle, prevent and relieve muscle soreness)

6FADEA80342249E68D79500B3C8693BE.description: Explains in his/her own words the importance of pacing oneself, depending on the activity (e.g. to vary one’s speed while running, in order to control one’s breathing)

99FE6D32EBB340C58E18FB89309AD826.description: Explains in his/her own words the importance of cooling down after a physical activity (e.g. to improve recovery, gradual transition to state of rest)

DD8101137CD04B4694354FF285FFAA47.description: Explains in his/her own words the importance of warming up before a physical activity (e.g. to increase body temperature, prepare the muscles for a more strenuous activity)

35E6A6B01EBA4EC98F485B1BB29E8B6A.description: Names the stages of a physical activity session (e.g. warm-up, performance, cool-down)

FF854B5EB53A452D900DD60D0E423265.description: Identifies the stages of a physical activity session

22DD41BED24C4DEEB2724F9578B12DFC.description: Names safety rules to observe in different physical activity settings (e.g. no running on the pool deck)

ADFFE946CCDB4C9382E85A11195188C9.description: Identifies behaviours to adopt (e.g. waiting one's turn, respecting the maximum height allowed when rope climbing)

38A89C3F025347E5A7E46E05861418CE.description: Identifies potentially dangerous situations (e.g. untied shoelaces, wearing jewellery, improperly placed mat, heatstroke)

85AC92D84E7F4780AB67E03AA02C01EC.description: Recognizes potentially dangerous situations associated with a physical activity practised alone or with others

D8181A0B706247AE92B27F7E3295EA56.description: Identifies a few exercises with a risk of injury (e.g. hyperextension of the neck, bending upper body while keeping legs straight)

756036436ADE4FBE9EA630DA0C8A7664.description: Explains in his/her own words the importance of wearing appropriate clothing for a given physical activity or context (e.g. proper footwear, appropriate clothing for the weather)

328F3DF5948C457AB4CB09ECA28EB5A1.description: Names the safety rules for putting away equipment (e.g. waiting one’s turn to put away one’s racket)

F1A59479E29747D496F54CF479D95C95.description: Names the safety rules for placing equipment (e.g. placing mats at a safe distance from the wall or the work area of other teams)

77D9B2A74D694548A5B16880DA29408C.description: Explains the importance of using equipment safely in accordance with the type of physical activity (e.g. to prevent injury to oneself and to others)

EBCE7D73BDFF4AAF90950B00EE265BA7.description: Explains in his/her own words the proper use of physical education equipment (light and heavy)

564574A88AAE4450B0F9D77BC3B73E17.description: Describes a few social benefits of his/her physical activity experience (e.g. new friends, harmonious interpersonal relations, conflict management)

B601B55E9219465AAA6A36E1AE3986EB.description: Describes a few physiological benefits of his/her physical activity experience (e.g. improved fitness, more energy)

4C3470858A094948ACBA3C377B5487BE.description: Describes a few psychological benefits of his/her physical activity experience (e.g. enjoyment, relaxation, feeling of competence)

06EEF547D8264B6291815732DA942306.description: Names lifestyle habits that are detrimental to health and well-being (e.g. smoking, poor posture)

8594374EC10742C5BFFB7D20B34525FF.description: Names lifestyle habits that are conducive to health and well-being (e.g. regular physical activity)

FD65D577CAD140629F236A8890CD1481.description: Explains in his/her own words the concepts of lifestyle habits and health (e.g. action often carried out every day for one’s health; state of physical and psychological well-being)

137B13AFCEFD43968A373FBFF5ADE07F.description: Knowledge (lifestyle habits)- Competency 3: To adopt a healthy, active lifestyle

7CDB956077B54F30843CF04DCC031643.description: Shows appreciation for the plays of his/her teammates and opponents

D1E5BAC5B9F7441FA2827BD0CD817693.description: Shows appreciation for the plays of his/her partner

559BB98D80D74BB18F7E83EC0C78CEC1.description: Shows appreciation for good plays by peers

6FB4E164610A4B8F93E69CC4C75965C2.description: Respects opponents in victory (e.g. accepts victory with modesty without ridiculing the opponent)

403AEAAC6ECA4FBB8A928B352559E6F7.description: Accepts defeat with dignity (e.g. controls his/her emotions, gives opponents credit for good plays)

7A9E7111B1684BF4A437E4AEE1F89F24.description: Shows a desire to surpass himself/herself

F68D88F34C2F4B4C92BA33EAC984805B.description: Demonstrates a certain fighting spirit (i.e. keeps trying, even in the face of defeat)

739DAAD62611463682753D6AAA71FA07.description: Gives everyone a chance to win (e.g. in a combat situation, confronts an opponent of the same skill level

D19DABD293B942579E8FA3B165187D42.description: Gives everyone a chance to play (e.g. gives others a chance to get the object)

1AC163A1FDE047E8BF50BEAA0590E726.description: Uses language that shows respect for the referee

8681F1BA8630477E8C7A0C9C569A1816.description: Helps partners who are having difficulty

41009A946A2444ACB44DB56FED7D7362.description: Treats his/her opponents with respect (e.g. refrains from using violent or aggressive behaviour)

2853118BCC804B4282BA36D907933DC2.description: Uses language that shows respect for opponents

482AECD6912B4E488A3C764C0E9DF1BC.description: Respects the point of view or ideas of others

FB64B242B40F4B4B93F9E48AC86C9C46.description: Uses language that shows respect for his/her partner

856ADFB461354009B46281E5AB78A2FD.description: Names a few values that can be developed through games and sports (e.g. respect, friendship, honesty)

DDB79419DAEA46AAA40D2832730DA491.description: Explains in his/her own words the rules of ethics relevant to a situation (e.g. in a tag and chase game, refraining from using unfair tactics to win at all costs)

A32AC37D25704016ABB3905DF3E31C93.description: Behaviour- Competency 2: To interact with others in different physical activity settings

411AFD5B930F45DF837B761F660B0002.description: Recovers the object (e.g. moves quickly toward the point where the object will fall)

1DAC2FC29E3F4002922FB8CC8D10ADAE.description: Protects his/her territory (e.g. positions himself/herself in an assigned area to prevent the object from landing in that area)

9963F5C16CA1439182F56F67D049ECB1.description: Attacks by projecting the object into an open space in the opponents’ territory (e.g. serves a volleyball by taking advantage of space left open by the opposing team)

5A550954C1BE42878E5FEB1F028D5203.description: Attacks by projecting the object into the opponents’ territory (e.g. returns the ball to the opposite end of the playing area

C1CAD0F3E11B4D13A17652DDEABB41E7.description: Keeps the object moving (e.g. passes to a teammate, assumes a favourable attack position)

0DFE57C9926D4F019E3B8D5B19C74C8D.description: Cooperation-opposition movements or actions in group activities in separate spaces (e.g. mini-volleyball)

8D986562A30F40F4AF49F3E914FF5D49.description: Protects the goal (target): Positions himself/herself between the object (carrier) and the target (e.g. protects the key in mini-basketball, puts a wall in place in mini-handball), Stops throws or shots (e.g. blocks, deflects, catches)

9D307A5EAE834DDEAEBC90A06794EB02.description: Guards a player: Guards the carrier to prevent him/her from attacking the goal, passing the object to a teammate or moving it forward, Guards the noncarrier to prevent him/her from receiving the object

DA2B97162CC9476885B1E74111012EA3.description: Falls back: Gets back in his/her defensive zone

357D050EE74E4F1CB389B8374EFBBAED.description: Gets free from an opponent or moves to an open space: Moves into an open space, Moves into an open space in relation to partners, Moves away from an opponent (e.g. makes a feint)

08BABCF8D4C2452D9E21DC462DFD5DBF.description: Recovers the object Moves toward the point where the object will fall (e.g. catches the rebound, recovers the ball after it hits the trampoline in tchoukball)

0329BCED585D42D18AF82367B12A1EF3.description: Moves the object forward: Moves toward the target, Moves toward an open space, Counterattacks

4F464FF554DC475FA2C13D9D62688A09.description: Keeps the object moving: Passes to an open or unguarded player, Passes to the player in the best position in relation to the target, Passes to the player in the best position in relation to opponents, Counterattacks (reattacks quickly following a defensive action)

9CCA947BD961467180E88554B57CED76.description: Throws or strikes the object, taking into account the opponents’ position

FF0AE557AC1345378BAC81049976DF79.description: Cooperation-opposition movements or actions in group activities in a common space (e.g. mini-basketball, kinball, capture the flag)

186FC6B7DDFC42578C860A1EB9692194.description: Deceives the opponent using a feint (e.g. changes the direction and path of the object)

80851D9AC98041589D2E795F7BDA07AC.description: Recovers the object (e.g. moves toward the point where the object will fall in order to recover it)

4A6BA29ECF8A41C591D24178ECA577D8.description: Uses the space available (e.g. attacks the space left open by the opponent, gets back to the centre of his/her game area)

A306CE7EBA6A4D3D90CECDA2337CF7CA.description: Opposition movements or actions in duelling activities in separate spaces (e.g. badminton, mini?tennis)

141F3AF0FF4B44CD8A7922979EA561A2.description: Deceives the opponent using a feint (e.g. changes direction or speed in a game of one-on-one)

8839F0642E874F14BA529E65FBE59A1D.description: Dodges an attack by the opponent (e.g. moves at the right time in order not to lose his/her flag)

2096D37E9E174C08951B1DC3450F68BE.description: Reaches the opponent (e.g. touches the opponent in a game of tag or in foam fencing)

A69867854EB64BAA94B4CA3C5B50680F.description: Gets away from the opponent (e.g. runs quickly away from the opponent)

C18110EE2617417F9F7D895E9CEC3B8D.description: Opposition movements or actions in duelling activities in a common space (e.g. tag and chase games)

65516681091541C58FA5721385156411.description: Deceives the opponent using a feint (e.g. pretends to pull in order to push)

E4695A38320D4C9E89C5411FD17C0C61.description: Blocks the opponent (e.g. keeps the opponent on the ground for three seconds)

4CD64E492C9845C5B7164BC02B0D3EF6.description: Reacts to movements or actions of the opponent (e.g. regains his/her balance, dodges an attack)

9084B1860C004312B98CD3C03A40972A.description: Throws the opponent off-balance (e.g. pushes and pulls in a friendly wrestling activity)

A2DE862404B246ABAE21E7B365EF02F8.description: Uses the space available (e.g. gets closer to or away from an opponent, gains advantage over an opponent using the boundaries of the combat area, regains his/her position by coming back to the centre of the mat)

6B7DA00B421847D78BBB1322C75CBBA4.description: Opposition movements or actions in combat activities (e.g. judo)

DEC687CE4A084029B87018089D814783.description: Positions himself/herself, moves or manipulates objects taking into account his/her partner(s) (e.g. creates a human pyramid, juggles with a partner)

66EAFF1856C745DB99990EDC2779E48A.description: Adapts his/her actions to those of several partners according to different synchronization modes (e.g. does a roll with other students and arrives at the same time at the center of the mat)

592925B7D7B14F56AB73B48944865B7D.description: Adapts his/her actions to those of a partner according to different synchronization modes (e.g. simultaneous, successive) (e.g. dribbles a ball at the same pace as a partner)

0BC11888B79C49D9A19C829A69AA6823.description: Synchronizes his/her movements or actions with partner(s)

FDADA6F7036046D18A547DE4601ABE8E.description: Receives an object using an implement while moving (e.g. uses a stick to receive a pass)

E7B068DBE0384CE3B058F14304B12BC4.description: Projects an object at a moving target using an implement (e.g. uses a stick to pass a ring to a partner who is moving)

10DD4083DB6C4868AF0CFE383C8038AE.description: Receives an object while moving (e.g. catches a Frisbee thrown by a partner)

BE00E16ABC4143569D7A005ADD7A81F3.description: Throws an object at a moving target (e.g. passes a ball to a partner who is moving)

B628037FF75E43CFABC054C535B6A539.description: Cooperates with partner(s) while performing movements or actions in the right place at the right time

249025E860D04442851ADFFAA3B43213.description: Motor Skills- Competency 2: To interact with others in different physical activity settings

420D04597EDC43B0816BBE6E07A447C2.description: Names a few defensive action rules (e.g. protecting an assigned area in his/her territory)

13ABE2CAB86748A5BB119E66B162BD28.description: Names a few offensive action rules (e.g. attacking the other team’s territory, keeping the object moving)

9864588CBE4E416FB3A5F2BCFE4F3735.description: Action rules in group activities in separate spaces

A26B0F987DE3475EBB609342A14D855E.description: Names a few defensive action rules (e.g. protecting his/her goal, getting back in the defensive zone)

E031ED0107AD44B69485A21A67A41CE0.description: Names a few offensive action rules (e.g. attacking the other team’s goal, moving the object forward)

15D7748888054052BF53C60F60C5863C.description: Action rules in group activities in a common space

18E94C55476E481EB1DABC1A9B7B7ADB.description: Names a few defensive action rules (e.g. using the space available to get away from an opponent)

D7158200B3CD41349D49E5AF08FF5702.description: Names a few offensive action rules (e.g. making a feint)

F0C091D1C2034F6ABB0D7417A31711C7.description: Names a few defensive action rules (e.g. reacting quickly to the actions of an opponent)

635CA5170E4042F8AA98B12EF8E65E20.description: Names a few offensive action rules (e.g. using the space available, throwing an opponent off-balance, making a feint)

1A74A674F6A14CBAA6401BA6B9382432.description: Strategies (action rules)- Competency 2: To interact with others in different physical activity settings

D32AAE2BEB2D4C0E9C73FF68B95BE6B5.description: Distinguishes the main types of support roles (e.g. scorekeeper, timekeeper, referee)

270C3097DB174599BFAEF73273C0E720.description: Names the main positions occupied by players of a given activity (e.g. top and base in acrobatic gymnastics)

6EF9A2CD0DD947CB83A9898422099F72.description: Explains in his/her own words the main actions of a noncarrier (e.g. moving into an open space, calling the object)

B72486162F094A00878408C0A0B82D23.description: Explains in his/her own words the main actions of a carrier (e.g. moving the object forward, protecting the object)

07964987C0E74A5680EA12C77437EE2E.description: Explains in his/her own words the main actions of a team captain or leader (e.g. calling a play in kinball, rounding up his/her teammates)

D3DAA1198A714166817FA56F91B4C722.description: Explains in his/her own words the main actions of a defensive player (e.g. protecting his/her territory, guarding a player, preventing goals)

22365936829E408F93D874D0C1763AF4.description: Explains in his/her own words the main actions of an offensive (attacking) player (e.g. moving into open space, moving the object forward, scoring a goal)

C659ED093B8A490090CF3711981BBC33.description: overlapping (i.e. performing a sequence of movements or actions starting at different times)

B95B2C5C4A564DABBDBB5FF822154589.description: alternating (i.e. repeating movements or actions in turns)

C364EB11E225415DAEF82E506918D2FB.description: successive (i.e. performing movements or actions one after the other)

1F3B746339D340C5ACAC1795306D834D.description: simultaneous (i.e. performing identical or different movements or actions at the same time)

C9DCB44D6F4F4141BD15E63633D95EB3.description: when receiving an object (e.g. moving quickly to the appropriate spot to catch a ball thrown by a teammate)

08CF309960F7449984E186C84349A9AE.description: when throwing an object (e.g. keeping track of a partner’s movement and throwing him/her a pass at the right time)

B1BBAC107EB5467580438DAE0B048707.description: Indicates a few ways of synchronizing his/her movements (i.e. performing movements or actions in the right place at the right time)

A03458493B584A0C8E448F288AC3CF24.description: Names different ways of communicating (e.g. calling out someone’s name, using a hand signal)

D2AB909DD6494F4BBEB456DC74D11279.description: Names a few ways of sending out misleading signals during game play (e.g. feinting using one’s body, looking to the right and then passing to the left)

1D40FFC5BAD5418694E1A7C9777FCC82.description: Names a few ways of being receptive to others’ messages (e.g. listening without interrupting, looking at the person who is speaking)

F58E9B2445B04F8BA0FE62795BD19D5E.description: Names a few ways of being understood by others (e.g. making eye contact, giving a signal, asking a question)

7AD4953739A844D7BDA6DE699E5E3B24.description: Knowledge- Competency 2: To interact with others in different physical activity settings

68F8502400444521A60433C7805E5A41.description: Catches a variety of objects used in specialized activities (e.g. tchoukball, ultimate Frisbee, mini-football)

97D7124E9F1D4DE5844B7058CE3D6705.description: Catches an object using an implement (e.g. throws a ball against a wall and catches it with an intercrosse stick)

2BB17DFE4B724DED8B05C18C77A82A08.description: Catches an object using his/her foot in different ways (e.g. deflects, blocks, traps or controls)

0E06592E336C4AB18FD10CD24889BEF8.description: Catches a variety of objects using one hand (e.g. catches a ball after one bounce on the floor)

2AE9CCE8ED9742E1BA03BCE5DF3F557D.description: Catches a variety of objects using two hands (e.g. catches a ball after throwing it against a wall)

C328D78444B6444CBDCCC8B15C08F123.description: Receiving objects with or without an implement

FB4960A2DABA44408F8F4DAAB66CF995.description: Throws or strikes an object using an implement for specialized activities (e.g. mini-tennis, hockey)

D4A266A59F4D4C829B41438284B09DD3.description: Strikes a variety of objects at a target using an implement (e.g. hits a foam ball against a wall using a racket)

EE28820821EE4224867BA39E3F16B943.description: Throws a variety of objects at a target using an implement (e.g. uses a stick to throw a ring at a bowling pin)

B7EE440866D441B29D9B54FA8D832767.description: Throws, strikes or kicks a variety of objects used in specialized activities (e.g. track and field, mini-basketball, mini-volleyball, soccer)

41F6F30A54F44B1CAA8605C4A7F64D31.description: Strikes or kicks a variety of objects at a target (e.g. kicks a ball toward a bowling pin)

E9639A9C9FC6430985B0F0B7DA22134C.description: Throws a variety of objects overhand at a target (e.g. throws a ball at a target on the wall)

EA87583F70114DB29BB1C49ED45829FD.description: Throws a variety of objects underhand at a target (e.g. throws a beanbag into a container, throws a ball at a bowling pin)

A8E5620D2CBF4768909FAD87D9E59124.description: Juggles different patterns while moving, using three objects

ACFAD1431BEA4875A437402857916A09.description: Juggles different patterns, using two objects and three objects

5362CCFA6D40455CA61D2C7E2E994F12.description: Dribbles with feet on the spot and while moving and through obstacles
